org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context

Class NeighbourSelectionWithContext<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>,C extends AssignmentContext>

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.cpsolver.ifs.assignment.context.NeighbourSelectionWithContext<V,T,C>
  • Type Parameters:
    V - Variable
    T - Value
    C - Assignment Context
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    CanHoldContext, HasAssignmentContext<V,T,C>, NeighbourSelection<V,T>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ExamConstruction, ExamGreatDeluge, ExamHillClimbing, ExamNeighbourSelection, ExamSimulatedAnnealing, ExamTabuSearch, FixCompleteSolutionNeighbourSelection, MaxIdleNeighbourSelection, MetaHeuristicSearch, NeighbourSearch, ParallelConstruction, SimpleSearch

    public abstract class NeighbourSelectionWithContext<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>,C extends AssignmentContext>
extends Object
implements NeighbourSelection<V,T>, HasAssignmentContext<V,T,C>, CanHoldContext
    A neighborhood selection with an assignment context. In order to be able to hold multiple assignments in memory it is desired for all the assignment dependent data a selection may need (to keep its current state), to store these data in a separate class (implementing the AssignmentContext interface). This context is created by calling HasAssignmentContext.createAssignmentContext(Assignment) and accessed by ConstraintWithContext.getContext(Assignment).
    Version:
    IFS 1.3 (Iterative Forward Search)

      • getContext

        public C getContext(Assignment<V,T> assignment)
        Returns an assignment context associated with this selection. If there is no assignment context associated with this selection yet, one is created using the HasAssignmentContext.createAssignmentContext(Assignment) method. From that time on, this context is kept with the assignment.
        Specified by:
        getContext in interface HasAssignmentContext<V extends Variable<V,T>,T extends Value<V,T>,C extends AssignmentContext>
        Parameters:
        assignment - given assignment
        Returns:
        assignment context associated with this selection and the given assignment
